item.title: Angie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Angie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Angie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Angie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men." -- Mae West

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Angie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Life itself is a quotation." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Angie add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Don't be ridiculous, Charlie, people love the parents who beat their kids in department stores. It's the ones who just let their kids wreak havoc that everybody hates." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Angie add a quote by Russell Brand
item.description: "I couldn't possibly have sex with someone with such a slender grasp on grammar!" -- Russell Brand

item.title: Angie add a quote by Ruth Rendell
item.description: "Some say life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Ruth Rendell

item.title: Angie add a quote by Tasha Alexander
item.description: "Oh, I don't read. I skulk about in search of quotations that might make me appear educated." -- Tasha Alexander

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "I forgive nothing. If you stole my orange crayon in the fifth grade, you're still on my hit list, buddy." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "People who truly love us can be divided into two categories: those who understand us, and those who forgive us our worst sins. Rarely do you find someone capable of both." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Angie add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Angie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Angie add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Angie add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Angie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Angie add a quote by Shelby Foote
item.description: "A university is just a group of buildings gathered around a library." -- Shelby Foote

item.title: Angie add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "To speak behind others' backs is the ventilator of the heart." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Angie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I'm running on hate. When the energy from that ebbs I'll be worthless." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Angie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Angie add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Angie add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "The unfed mind devours itself." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Angie add a quote by Craig Ferguson
item.description: "He was in awe of the thirst that people had for someone to tell them that everything was going to be all right. He marveled at the gullibility and vulnerability of his fellow humans. No wonder the churches called them sheep. They were woolly-headed pack animals being herded around for the benefit of whoever knew how to control the dogs." -- Craig Ferguson

item.title: Angie add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Angie add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description:
"A bookshelf is as particular to its owner as are his or her clothes; a personality is stamped on a library just as a shoe is shaped by the foot."
[<i>Baffled at a Bookcase</i> (<i>London Review of Books</i>, Vol. 33 No. 15, 28 July 2011)]" -- Alan Bennett
